channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024021513
item.description:
Report X-2024021513

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pail fell from rollers. Qa responded and cleaned up the area and secured contents in a hazmat tote and bag. DescribePack: The lid busted off. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The container and waste were placed in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020865
item.description:
Report X-2024020865

  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package had come out of the trailer damaged and the bag out of the plastic pail. The damaged hazmat came to QA to be processed, also this package was improperly labeled in the sense of the label itself. The label shows as a normal package when this is a hazmat DescribePack: Their is a puncture the size of approx. 1.5 feet allowing the bag of DurationRel: 45 and MitigateEffect: minimalize shaking of the pail

item.title: Report X-2024021188
item.description:
Report X-2024021188

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unload process wet and was placed into lined tote and QA was notified. DescribePack: Loose cap caused the inner container to leak and damage the outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined hazmat tote with orientation arrows up to avoid any further leaks.

The caps of the jerricans were loose and leaked its contents DescribePack: The lids of the jerricans are broken and caused internal leakage DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: To minimalize shaking and keep the tins upright

item.title: Report X-2024021128
item.description:
Report X-2024021128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While on the rollers waiting to be loaded hazmat toppled over when another box was placed next to it. The insufficient inner packing caused the lid to easily become loose. DescribePack: Box became wet inside and out along with a big tear coming down the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was then immediately picked up by trained QA and placed in a yellow drum lined with hazmat bags to prevent further leakage while properly processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021140
item.description:
Report X-2024021140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found while preload was unloading a trailer (450898). It already had a strong smell of the spilled contents and package was wet and stained. DescribePack: The contents of the container spilled out, almost all the contents. Upon inspection, when the material was lifted that was on the bottle, it was noticed that a cap wasn't there. Unsure how that may have happened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020922
item.description:
Report X-2024020922

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-04
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer 838729 around 5:30am. The first thing noticed was the smell and then saw that package was leaking. DescribePack: No holes or damage to the package. One bottle broke inside, spilling out all of the contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a lined hazmat tote. It was then taken to the hazmat cage to await processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021113

Report X-2024021113

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process, roughly after 7am the package was brought for inspection. DescribePack: The cap seal is intact. There is a crack towards the base of the bottle causing an internal leak. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Hazardous materials package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag.

Report X-2024021261

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR THE UNLOAD WALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE. CLEANED UP ANY UNABSORBED LIQUID AND PLACE PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY. TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024020756
item.description:
Report X-2024020756

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HazMat was discovered with a puncture on the body of inner container. Package was placed a lined HazMat tote. Surfaces that were leak on were cleaned in house. DescribePack: The puncture is on the bottom right corner of the container. Size of the puncture no greater than a dime. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: HazMat was removed from the floor and placed in HazMat cage. Surfaces affected were cleaned up in house.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the morning with wet box, it was brought to the damage cage for further inspection, we placed it in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Upon inspection I found the box wet because the content had loose cap, causing spilled approximately 1 oz. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was separated, placed in an hazmat bag and hazmat tote and relocated to the hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report I-2023110069
item.description:
Report I-2023110069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pax gave Flight Attendant a smoking vape device and she brought it to the forward Lavatory where all the Flight Attendants poured water into the Fire Containment bag (FCB) and then we sealed the device inside and took the FCB to a cart in the aft galley.
